Standard_Text: Listen to, view, and read stories, poems, and plays.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Select appropriate information technology tools and resources to interact with others for a specific purpose.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Deliver brief recitations and oral presentations about familiar experiences or interests.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Seek, produce, and share information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading 500,000 words annually by grade four (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use digital or graphic tools to support a presentation.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Organize information chronologically, sequentially, or by topic.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare information from more than one source to draw a conclusion.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify types of personal information and appropriate and inappropriate ways to share it.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Define cyberbullying and its effects.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students use information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Locate facts and details to support a topic sentence and paragraph, and record the information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Consider the need for additional information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the role and responsibility of the author and publisher to determine accuracy of published materials.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify copyright and publication dates in print resources.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine whether the information answers the question.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Select information appropriate to the problem or question at hand.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the relevance of the information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students evaluate information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Apply techniques for organizing notes in a logical order (e.g., outlining, webbing, thinking maps, other graphic organizers).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate respectful and responsible behavior in the library.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate a basic understanding of intellectual property rights and the difference between sharing and ownership.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Locate information in text by using the organizational parts of a book in print or digital format (e.g., title, table of contents, chapter headings, glossary, author notes, dedication, index).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Locate and know the arrangement and general content of the biography section in the library.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use print or digital indexes, or both, to locate articles in an encyclopedia.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use specialized content-area print and digital resources to locate information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the organization of general reference resources in print and/or digital formats, including a dictionary, thesaurus, atlas, almanac, and encyclopedia.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Perform a key word search of a topic by using an approved search engine or database.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use guide words to locate information in a reference book.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify types of media and digital delivery devices.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Independently browse the library to locate materials.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand different systems of alphabetizing (e.g., letter by letter, word by word).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the information on spine labels, including call numbers.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand that nonfiction print and nonprint materials in a library are arranged by subject (e.g., Dewey decimal system).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Perform a basic search of the automated library catalog by title, author, subject, and key word.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the general purpose of the library catalog.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Differentiate between primary and secondary sources.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand that the function of a library is to provide shared resources that are organized to be accessible to all library users.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify a problem that needs information by asking how, what, where, when, or why questions.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Formulate appropriate questions:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify key words within questions.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize the need for information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students access information.
Subject: Library (2010-)
